inventory.commentary: modified definitions, added examples and features. ahouston 1dec08

sense.name: area outside the city
sense.examples: Aunt Sally lives way out in the country If you hate concrete so much then you should move out to the country.

sense.name: sociopolitical group of people
sense.commentary: COUNTRY[+group][+people][+sociopolitical] The people represented by and comprising a nation.
sense.examples: The country's new leader will take office next month. The two countries have ended their animosities. Their country has a trade surplus and ours has a deficit. (Note: the country is a proxy for the people who are affected by the trade status) The whole country is rooting for their soccer team.

sense.name: geopolitical location
sense.commentary: The land owned by a government and the government itself.
sense.examples: Italy is the boot-shaped country in Europe. Their country is rich in natural resources Every village green throughout the country has a war memorial. Their country is arid and largely uninhabited except along the river.

sense.name: a region, location characterized informally by a trait
sense.commentary: COUNTRY[+location][+region][+informal][+characterized][+by_trait] Area of land informally defined as having some particular characteristic. Usually directly preceded by a noun or adjective.
sense.examples: Welcome to potato country. We don't do that sort of thing out here in farm country. They don't sell electronics out in Amish country. Joe lives in Bible country. You'll need to be more careful in bear country.
